intro: Actinostemon angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf actinostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with similar climates.
